[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentences with nested clauses may strain readability in some instances (e.g., "If the decadence of Christmas were a purely subjective phenomenon...").
[LEXICON]: Archaic phrasing ("larked," "salvoes") may require reader interpretation but does not impede overall fluency.
[PUNCTUATION]: Semicolon usage in compound sentences could be more consistent in some cases.

[LOGIC]: Sudden shift from personal anecdote about the brother to broader sociological analysis of children's role in traditions feels abrupt.
[CLARITY]: The title "The Feast of St. Friend" is unexplained and potentially confusing in relation to the Christmas theme.
[STRUCTURE]: The transition between Chapter 1's nostalgic narrative and Chapter 2's analytical reasoning could be smoother.
